com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class DocumentViewerMessageHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentViewerMessageHandler

  • public abstract class DocumentViewerMessageHandler
extends Object
    DocumentViewers occasionally wish to interact with each other. For example the tree viewer can tell the sequence viewer which sequences to select.

    Communication between DocumentViewers which are currently viewing the same set of documents is implemented using both an incoming message handler and an outgoing message handler. When Geneious instantiates a DocumentViewer it assigns its outgoing message handler using DocumentViewer.setOutgoingMessageHandler(DocumentViewerMessageHandler).

    When a DocumentViewer wishes to send a message, it can do the following:
    getOutgoingMessageHandler().handleMessage(...)
    This broadcasts the message to all DocumentViewers on the same set of documents.

    When the DocumentViewer wants to receive messages, it must return a DocumentViewerMessageHandler from DocumentViewer.getIncomingMessageHandler() on which handleMessage(org.jdom.Element, String, boolean) will be called when a message is received.

    • Method Detail

      • handleMessage

        public abstract boolean handleMessage(org.jdom.Element message,
                    String senderName,
                    boolean focusReciever)
        Handle an incoming or outgoing message
        Parameters:
        message - the message to handle. This can be any valid XML. It is up to the DocumentViewers to define a DTD for the XML accepted. For example, SequenceViewer accepts messages such as <select><sequence>Sequence Name</sequence><sequence>another sequence name</sequence></select> However, sending a selection message using handleMessage is deprecated. Use setSequenceSelection(SequenceSelection, String) instead.
        senderName - Some token identifiying the sender, say its class name
        focusReciever - true to change the focus to the viewer which accepts the message. Incoming handlers should ignore this parameter.
        Returns:
        true if message was "accepted" by any of the viewers, false otherwise. If focusReciever is true, then the first viewer that accepts the message will be focused. Incoming message handlers should return true if they accept the message, false if not.

      • setSequenceSelection

        public boolean setSequenceSelection(SequenceSelection newSelection,
                           String senderName)
        Notifies when the selected sequence or residues has changed in a viewer.

        For incoming handlers this indicates that the selection has changed in another viewer and this viewer should change to that selection if possible. Should be ignored if the viewer has incompatible unsaved changes. Incoming handlers don't have to worry about not firing the outgoing handler as the result of an incoming change. Geneious ignores them automatically.

        For outgoing handlers this should be called whenever the selection has changed in the viewer to notify all other viewers. Should not be called if the viewer has incompatible unsaved changes.

        This method will (and must) always be called in the Swing thread.

        Parameters:
        newSelection - the new sequence selection
        senderName - Some token identifiying the sender, say its class name
        Returns:
        true if message was "accepted" by any of the viewers, false otherwise. Incoming message handlers should return true if they accept the message, false if not.
